Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that a nuclear war had started between NATO and Russia, when in reality, no such incident took place and the video was labeled as a work of fiction.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that no nuclear war had occurred between NATO and Russia.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or factual basis to support the assertion that a nuclear war had started.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the video report from the BBC is accurate and reliable, when in fact it was a fictional dramatization.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of alternative explanations being presented in the claim.
